description: Dive into "Geneva's Picture-Perfect Moments" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Geneva's Picture-Perfect Moments

places.generalDescription: The Conservatory and Botanical Garden Geneva is a sprawling 28-hectare green space nestled in the heart of the city, near Ariana garden and Lake Geneva. It houses an impressive collection of nearly 16,000 plant species from around the world. Visitors can explore themed gardens, rockeries, and greenhouses that display a diverse range of flora.

sources.snippet: The Botanical Garden of Geneva is located between the Palais des Nations and Lake Geneva. Little known to tourists, it is an oasis of greenery that is worth a look after the visit to the United Nations headquarters.
sources.shortName: Visit Geneva: TOP 23 Things To Do and Must See

places.name: Conservatoire et Jardin botaniques de la Ville de Gen√®ve

reviews.text: I like visiting botanical gardens when I go on a city break and this has to rank amongst the best. Beautiful, well tended gardens very much with a natural focus but with more formal gardens too. Lovely meandering paths and water gardens as well as a fabulous set of green houses. Definitley worth a visit. We went twice in one long weekend. Was flowering when we were there but I am guessing the wisteria we saw coiled around a frame on the path with be something!

Botanical gardens of Geneva are huge and keep at least an hour to explore this place. It is impressive but tge greenhouses inside it are disappointing. Very narrow and less place. Also lacks varities of plants and colours. The entry to this place is free and if you love nature and have spare time you can come here and explore this place. It is very good but not a must visit place.

Entrance opposite Geneva Schengen station (there are several) Free entry.
I can't recommend this park enough. Absolutely stunning. Tbh, I was surprised how few people were there. This may have been down to the extremely high temperatures the area is experiencing (mid-August).

places.generalDescription: The Jet d'Eau de Gen√®ve is an iconic fountain located on Lake Geneva in the downtown area, and it's a must-see attraction. This stunning landmark pumps half a cubic meter of water per second, shooting it 140 meters into the air. Originally serving as a safety valve for hydraulics generated by the Rhone River, it has become a symbol of Geneva. Visitors from around the world are drawn to its spectacular views and impressive display of water.

sources.snippet: Stroll around Lac L√©man (Lake Geneva), in the centre of Geneva, and you can‚Äôt miss the impressive Jet d‚Äôeau water fountain. Jet D‚ÄôEau is one of Geneva‚Äôs most instantly recognisable sights and easily Geneva‚Äôs most famous landmark, with the water jetting a whopping 140 metres into the air. It is the highest water fountain in Europe, and one of the tallest fountains in the world!
sources.shortName: 17 Geneva Instagram Spots - Best Instagrammable Places in Geneva!

sources.snippet: The iconic fountain is probably the main tourist attraction in Geneva, it was built in 1886 and is one of the tallest fountains in the world, measuring 140m in height. The fountain became a symbol of the city and because of this, it was moved to the center of the lake in 1891. You can get some great pictures of the fountain from just about anywhere.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Instagrammable Places in Geneva That Will Blow Your Mind!

sources.snippet: The iconic Jet d‚ÄôEau is synonymous with Geneva, and it easy to see why. A powerful jet of water that blasts x meters in the sky, can practically be seen from most areas around the lake. With any famous landmark it has been overly photographed from practically every perspective with a plethora of cameras.
sources.shortName: 10 Places to Photograph in Geneva | by hulobok

sources.snippet: Our list " what to see in Geneva" opens the symbol of Switzerland - Jet d'Eau. It is one of the highest fountains in the world, its height reaches 140 meters. The fountain was built in 1886, it flows from the middle of the lake, and it is certainly one of the most recognizable Geneva sights.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in Geneva

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for a truly unique experience, then a visit to the Jet d‚ÄôEau is a must. This massive fountain is one of Geneva‚Äôs most iconic landmarks, and it‚Äôs easy to see why. The Jet d‚ÄôEau shoots water 140 metres into the air, making it an impressive sight.
sources.shortName: BEST Instagrammable Places In Geneva In 2022

sources.snippet: A symbol of Geneva, Jet D‚Äôeau is a must-see spot in this amazing city. Can you imagine a 140m tall water jet protruding from a lake?. Yeah, it truly is a sight to remember.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Spots In Geneva

sources.snippet: Incredibly, this fountain was built way back in 1886 and measures 140m in height when at its peak. Step back for some unique perspective shots. View this post on Instagram
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Geneva

sources.snippet: From the iconic Jet d‚ÄôEau to the charming Old Town, this immersive experience promises to take your photography skills to new heights.
sources.shortName: Explore The Instaworthy Spots Of Geneva With A Local

places.name: Jet d'Eau de Gen√®ve

reviews.text:
Jet d'Eau is not just a fountain - it's an experience! üí¶
The moment you see that powerful stream of water rising high into the sky, you feel something different‚Ä¶ something magical.
Located in the heart of Geneva, with the lake and mountains in the background, the view is simply breathtaking.
It's one of those places that stays in your memory forever.
If you're traveling to Switzerland, Geneva is a must, and Jet d'Eau is a stop you can't miss! üá®üá≠‚ú®

The Jet d'Eau in Geneva is absolutely breathtaking and one of the most iconic landmarks in Switzerland. Watching the fountain shoot up to 140 meters high is a mesmerizing experience, especially when the sunlight hits the water and creates a beautiful rainbow across the mist - it feels magical and unforgettable.

The atmosphere around the lake is peaceful yet full of life, with people walking, cycling, and enjoying the fresh air. The sound of the water combined with the gentle breeze makes it the perfect spot to relax and take in the beauty of Geneva.

What I loved the most was standing close enough to feel the cool spray of the fountain while watching the rainbow appear - it's like nature and the city coming together in harmony. Whether during the day with the sparkling sunlight or in the evening when the city lights reflect on the water, the Jet d'Eau never loses its charm.

Truly, visiting this fountain is not just about seeing a monument, but about experiencing the soul of Geneva itself. Highly recommended to anyone visiting the city!
Geneva's iconic fountain shoots 140m into the air ‚Äì you really can't miss it. Walked the pier, got misted and loved it. Simple, dramatic and a must-see on the lake.

sources.snippet: Since Geneva is located on a lake and Switzerland, as you know, is a country of crystal clear lakes, many of the Geneva sights are somehow connected with water. The Bains des Paquis is one of the best Geneva attractions, which is loved not only by tourists but also by the citizens themselves. These are the most popular public outdoor baths in the heart of the city, on an artificial island connected to the " mainland" by a bridge.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in Geneva

sources.snippet: Geneva offers a vast number of spas, but none of them is as interesting and appealing as the Bains des P√¢quis. It is placed on Lake Geneva with public swimming baths that date back to the 1930s. Open all year round and reasonably priced, this place is perfect for the sauna, dip, massage, famous fondue, and affordable lunch in a comfortable environment.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Spots In Geneva

sources.snippet: The Bains des Paquis is a public beach located on the shores of Lake Geneva. The beach is a great place to relax and take in the stunning views of the lake and the mountains beyond. The Bains des Paquis is also home to a number of restaurants and bars, making it the perfect spot to enjoy a meal or a drink with a view.
sources.shortName: BEST Instagrammable Places In Geneva In 2022

sources.snippet: A 360¬∞ panoramic view of the lake, the Jet d‚ÄôEau, the harbour and St. Peter‚Äôs Cathedral, what a delight!. Especially while enjoying a good lunch or fondue round the wood stove!. The Bains des P√¢quis (P√¢quis baths), a genuine peninsula on the lake, have always been a joy for Genevans and visitors alike.
sources.shortName: Sightseeing in Geneva: Views and Landmarks

sources.snippet: The Bains des P√¢quis (P√¢quis Bath) is a very important place in Geneva city life. In addition of being the ideal swimming spot in the heart of the city, it‚Äôs also very pleasant for its friendly and joyful atmosphere. Everyone, at every age, is coming here!.
sources.shortName: Visit Geneva: TOP 23 Things To Do and Must See

reviews.text:
Cost ‚Ç¨2 to swim in a beach that's literally right next to all that's hip and happening!! Great changing rooms, great swimming area, looked like everyone else had a great time too!!
And not that the beach gets credit, but the water was perfect temp.
I didn't try any other beaches in Geneva, but I got nothing bad to say about this one.

Nice place to swim, jump into Lake Geneva, play on kids playground and get food (fondu and more) and drinks. Parking is difficult though - - try the hotel garage a few blocks away. Cheap (2 Euros per person), yet if you leave, you'll have to pay to re-enter on the same day.

An exceptional place in the heart of Geneva city on the lake.
Beach and lake swimming pool in summer and a fabulous steam bath and sauna in winter time.
I can also highly recommend their restaurant with greate dishes and local specialtys in the very casual surrounding of the bath.

places.generalDescription: Parc La Grange is a large park located by the lakeside in Geneva, Switzerland. It features a stunning rose garden known as 'La Roseraie' with over 100 different rose varieties, making it a popular summer destination. The park also offers scenic views of the lake and hosts summer concerts on its stage.

sources.snippet: Parc La Grange, located on the Eaux-Vives side of the lake, invites you to stroll around and enjoy autumn. The park offers a sublime view of the lake and the orange-coloured trees open their leaves on the bright blue lake. Here photographers and lovers of beautiful pictures wander around happily in search of the best shot.
sources.shortName: The most beautiful autumn photo spots in Geneva
The most beautiful autumn photo spots in geneva

sources.snippet: This is the largest city park in Geneva that lies on the shore of the lake at Quai Gustave-Ador. It expands over terraces and its stairways have been carved from the bedrock. It was inhabited by rich people for 2 000 years and there are ruins of a Roman villa that lies behind the 18th-century villa.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Spots In Geneva

sources.snippet: The Parc de la Grange is a large park in the centre of Geneva. The park is home to a variety of plants and trees, and it‚Äôs a great place to relax or take a walk. The Parc de la Grange is also a popular spot for photographers, as it offers beautiful views of the city.
sources.shortName: BEST Instagrammable Places In Geneva In 2022

sources.snippet: A short walk on the Jet d‚ÄôEau side of Lake Geneva you will find Parc de la Grange. It‚Äôs a nice large green space to walk around, take a nap under the sun or just enjoy a picnic. What‚Äôs worth seeing I think is the Rose Garden near the front of the park.
sources.shortName: 10 Places to Photograph in Geneva | by hulobok
Visit Geneva: TOP 23 Things To Do and Must See

places.name: Parc La Grange

reviews.text:
Another beautiful park in the area of Lac Leman or Geneva Lake.

This park is located across La Lemmon or Geneva Lake, side-by-side with parc des aux vives.

It's a big park with wonderful lines of trees, walking pathway and benches. The gate has the famous lions adorning its pillars. Across the park, you can enjoy enjoy Lac Leman and Jet d'eau, the famous icon of Geneva.

It has parking lot in front of it, including spots for ‚ôøÔ∏è. It's not that many and it can be very crowded during the weekend or when the weather is lovely.

It's a great place for leisure walk and I saw many walk with their pets. Make sure you follow the rules while visiting this park.
Always very pleasant walks, especially at the end of the day during the golden hour. The views of the lake and the springtime flowers are stunning. One of Geneva's hidden gems.

Parc La Grange, nestled along the left bank of Lake Geneva, stands as one of the city's most enchanting green spaces. Spanning over 21 hectares, this historic park offers a harmonious blend of natural beauty, cultural heritage, and recreational facilities. Ôøº

A highlight of Parc La Grange is its expansive rose garden, renowned as the largest in Geneva. Established between 1945 and 1946, the garden showcases over 200 varieties of roses, creating a vibrant tapestry of colors and fragrances during the blooming season. The garden's design, featuring terraced layouts and a 19th-century pergola, provides a picturesque setting for leisurely strolls and photography.  Ôøº Ôøº

The park is home to the elegant 18th-century Villa La Grange, which has played host to significant historical events, including the 2021 summit between U.S. President Joe Biden and Russian President Vladimir Putin. The villa's rich history adds a layer of cultural depth to the park's serene environment.

places.generalDescription: St Pierre Cathedral, also known as St. Peters Cathedral, is a significant landmark in Geneva's Old Town. The cathedral boasts a mix of architectural styles, including Neoclassical, Romanesque, and Baroque elements. It is renowned as the adopted home church of Protestant Reformation leader John Calvin. Visitors can explore the plain yet impressive interior and discover treasures dating back to antiquity on the archaeological site.

sources.snippet: Geneva‚Äôs popular photo spots: The tour takes you to some of the most Instagrammable locations in Geneva, including the Jet d‚ÄôEau, St. Pierre Cathedral, and the picturesque Old Town. These spots offer breathtaking views and unique backdrops for your travel pictures.
sources.shortName: Explore The Instaworthy Spots Of Geneva With A Local

sources.snippet: The Villa Bob David is stunning bla bla Why not travel somewhere different on your next holiday with our top 31 best non-tourist places to visit in Europe. It seems most people travelling Europe go to the tourist hot spots such as Rome, London.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Instagrammable Places in Geneva That Will Blow Your Mind!

sources.snippet: The cathedral is one of the most important buildings in the city, and it‚Äôs a popular spot for tourists and photographers. The St. Pierre Cathedral offers stunning views of the city, and it‚Äôs a great place to take a break from sightseeing.
sources.shortName: BEST Instagrammable Places In Geneva In 2022

sources.snippet: St. Pierre Cathedral is one of our favorite instagrammable spots in Geneva. It offers a panoramic view from the highest point of the Old Town. The panorama you see once you pay 5 Swiss Francs to climb to the top is well worth it.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Spots In Geneva

sources.snippet: While the building itself is a wonderful sight, you‚Äôll definitely want to pay the 5 Swiss Francs to climb to the top and get that ultimate GenevaInstagram shot of the view. You‚Äôll find it here. View this post on Instagram
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Geneva

places.name: Cath√©drale Saint-Pierre Gen√®ve

reviews.text: The "Nothing to Photograph in ..." series has made its way to Cath√©drale Saint-Pierre Gen√®ve, highlighting its serene interior and breathtaking views from the towers. I highly recommend exploring this historic gem. Follow me to discover your next destination.

Impressive cathedral in the old town area with lots of period buildings around it. On a bit of a raised area but an easy walk up. Quiet, peaceful, can sit for as long as one likes. Free to enter, as it should be, but is not in some places. Different parts obviously built/added/repaired/rebuilt at different times, which is always interesting. Well worth a visit.

This cathedral is a highlight located in the center of Geneva's old town. The top offers a great view over the city and the lake. I recommend combining a visit with a walk to the beautiful nearby square "Place-Du-Bourg-de-Four" (my favourite place in old town). Take a break there for a snack and a drink. Enjoy!

places.generalDescription: Jardin Anglais is a picturesque English-inspired park located along the shores of Lake Geneva. Established in 1855, it offers serene green spaces with stunning lake views. The park features an 1862 fountain, a flower-clock sculpture, and beautifully-tended floral displays. In addition to being a popular venue for open-air concerts in summer, it hosts Noel au Jardin, Geneva's main Christmas market.

sources.snippet: The Jardin anglais, home to the famous Flower Clock and its 12,000 flowers, is a perfect spot to admire the harbour and take some amazing pictures.The lake stretches out in the distance with the Jet d‚ÄôEau rising spectacularly to 140 metres. Swans complete the picturesque decor, as they glide by and dive in search of algae or a piece of bread.
sources.shortName: Sightseeing in Geneva: Views and Landmarks

places.name: Jardin Anglais

reviews.text:
One of Geneva's most iconic landmarks, the Flower Clock (L'Horloge Fleurie), is a stunning fusion of art, nature, and Swiss precision. Located in the English Garden (Jardin Anglais), this giant outdoor clock was created in 1955 as a tribute to the city's long-standing tradition of watchmaking. Composed of over 6,500 seasonal flowers and plants that change throughout the year, the Flower Clock is not only a botanical masterpiece but also a functioning timepiece connected to a satellite for absolute accuracy.

Visitors are often left in awe by its vibrant colors and intricate design. It's not just the scale that impresses-stretching over five meters in diameter-but the way time is told so beautifully through nature. The second hand is the longest in the world, sweeping gracefully across a sea of blossoms.

More than just a photo spot, the Flower Clock represents Geneva's elegance, innovation, and deep respect for craftsmanship. Many tourists describe it as unexpectedly emotional-where time, beauty, and tradition intersect. A quiet moment spent admiring it often becomes one of the most memorable parts of any visit to Geneva.

The park itself is nothing too special and not large, but the attraction is of course the view of the lake and the water jet. There is also an old style Ferris wheel which is not very large but has a certain attraction to it for being small and looking kind of old with open cars. A good place for a stroll but of course large numbers of tourists.

‚ÄúIt's a small yet beautiful clock. I was pleasantly surprised to see it in a unique style, different from the usual pictures with blooming flowers. We visited on August 28, 2025, and learned that the clock's design changes with the seasons.‚Äù

places.generalDescription: Located in the Jardin des Alpes near Lake Geneva, the Brunswick Monument is a stunning neo-Gothic tomb honoring Duke Charles II of Brunswick. The mausoleum, built in 1877, features an equestrian statue of the duke and is constructed from exquisite materials like Carrara marble and Verona stone. Nearby attractions include the iconic Jet d'Eau fountain and the impressive Palace of Nations.

sources.snippet: The Brunswick Monument was built to celebrate the life of the Duke of Brunswick, Charles D‚ÄôEste-Guelph, who left the city all his money in return for the construction of this beautiful monument we have today. At the Brunswick Monument, you will also enjoy stunning views of Lake Geneva and Jet D‚Äôeau. Take a walk around the beautiful surrounding gardens where you find various monuments and colorful flower beds for even more Instagram opportunities.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Instagrammable Places in Geneva That Will Blow Your Mind!

sources.snippet: The Brunswick Monument is a monument in Geneva that was built to commemorate the Battle of Waterloo. It is definitely one of the most instagrammable places in Geneva. If you are ever in Geneva, you should definitely check out the Brunswick Monument.
sources.shortName: BEST Instagrammable Places In Geneva In 2022

places.name: Brunswick Monument

reviews.text: The Brunswick Monument is a beautiful historical landmark. The architecture is stunning, and it's a peaceful spot to reflect while enjoying the view. It's definitely worth visiting if you're in the area!
Beautiful monument with a lovely small park to relax. The grass may be wet, but you can also rest in one of the benches.
Beautiful place to have a nice walk and view. Beach and swimming area available with outdoor shower, changing cabins and washrooms.

places.address: Jardin des Alpes, Quai du Mont-Blanc, 1201 Gen√®ve, Switzerland

places.generalDescription: The Reformation Wall, located in the beautiful Parc Des Bastions in Geneva, is a significant monument honoring the Protestant Reformation and its influential figures. This international landmark features statues and bas-reliefs depicting key individuals such as John Calvin, Oliver Cromwell, William Farel, and others who played pivotal roles in the 16th-century movement. The wall serves as a tribute to the events and people of the Protestant Reformation and showcases the motto of Geneva inspired by Calvinist philosophy.

sources.snippet: Another Geneva attraction is the monument of statues and bas-reliefs, dedicated to the 400th anniversary of Jean Calvin's birth and the 350th anniversary of the founding of the Academy of Geneva (University of Geneva). The monument was opened in 1909 and was originally conceived as a tribute to the Reformation, freedom, and democracy. The monument looks very impressive and concise.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in Geneva

sources.snippet: Very close to the Promenade de la Treille is The Reformation Wall: a 30 foot high and 325 feet wide wall that is built into the Old City Walls and located inside Parc des Bastions. It features statues and bas-reliefs of heroes of the Protestant Reformation, and was built to commemorate freedom and democracy. The wall is very impressive as each statue is 15 feet tall!
sources.shortName: 17 Geneva Instagram Spots - Best Instagrammable Places in Geneva!

sources.snippet: The Reformation Wall honors hero‚Äôs, events and documents of the Protestant Reformation by depicting them in statues and bas-reliefs. Each statue stands 15 foot tall making it an incredible sight to behold. I would recommend getting there early so you can enjoy it in peace and get that perfect picture.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Instagrammable Places in Geneva That Will Blow Your Mind!

sources.snippet: The Reformation Wall is a monument located in Geneva‚Äôs Old Town. The wall commemorates the Protestant Reformation and features a number of statues of key figures from the movement. The Reformation Wall is a great spot for history buffs and photography enthusiasts alike.
sources.shortName: BEST Instagrammable Places In Geneva In 2022

sources.snippet: Located in one more Instagram-worthy spot in Geneva, the Parc des Bastions, the Reformation wall is something that a savvy Instagrammer will not skip. It was built to represent the main proponents of Calvinism. The length of the wall is 100m.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Spots In Geneva

places.name: Reformation Wall

reviews.text: This wall is located in a beautiful park and it is a very interesting installation that gives people an insight into the reformation movement. Loved reading about the people and the impact of reformation on Geneva.
A serene and vibrant location, where visitors can appreciate the rich history while observing locals enjoying the city's lively atmosphere. A wonderful spot to take in the essence of Genevian life.
Remembered a bit more about some on the notable men who came to settle in America. The sculptures and remembering history from way back was educational and a refresher.

places.generalDescription: The Flower Clock, also known as L'horloge fleurie, is an iconic outdoor clock in Geneva that was designed in 1955. It features a face made of 6,500 flowers and shrubs that are changed seasonally. The flowers reportedly open and close their petals according to the time of day. This floral timepiece pays tribute to Geneva's status as the birthplace of fine watchmaking and has become a symbol of the city since its inauguration.

sources.snippet: If you drive your Instagram, you can not pass the English Park and the Flower Clock located in it. The first version of the Flower Clock was created in 1755 by the Swedish scientist Carl Linnaeus, who then taught at the Universities of Geneva. Carl Linnaeus' flower clock set itself a completely practical goal: to interest students in an amazing natural phenomenon - the biorhythm of the life of flowers.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in Geneva

sources.snippet: In 1955 the flower clock was unveiled to acknowledge that Switzerland is the capital of making the finest most precise watches in the world. The flower clock is located on the western edge of the Jardin Anglais. An incredible 6,500 plants and shrubs are used to make the clock face and the flowers bloom with the different seasons of the year.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Instagrammable Places in Geneva That Will Blow Your Mind!

sources.snippet: The flower clock in the Jardin Anglais is a truly impressive sight. This massive clock is made entirely of flowers, and it‚Äôs truly a sight to behold. The clock is especially beautiful in the springtime when the annual flower show is taking place in the park.
sources.shortName: BEST Instagrammable Places In Geneva In 2022

sources.snippet: As we all know, Switzerland is famous for its craftsmanship of the finest and most precise watches in the word. One of the most instagrammable spots in Geneva is, no surprise, a clock. But not a mechanical one.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Spots In Geneva

places.name: L'Horloge Fleurie

reviews.text: The Flower Clock in Geneva is a stunning blend of nature and Swiss precision. Located in the English Garden (Jardin Anglais), this iconic floral timepiece is made up of thousands of seasonal flowers, carefully arranged and changed throughout the year. The clock is fully functional and symbolizes Switzerland's watchmaking tradition. It's a popular spot for tourists to take photos, especially with Lake Geneva nearby. While it's not a major attraction in terms of size, its beauty and symbolic charm make it well worth a quick visit if you're exploring the city.

Nice spot in front of Lake Leman. When we visited it in July 2025, it was full of street vendors who did not allow us to appreciate its beauty and the area is also under construction. It is also very close the Wheel is a beautiful place. Visit the place.

The best place to have a long walk and Geneva and enjoy the lovely weather in April.

Many places to seat and you can buy some snacks and chill with your family and friends.

Amazing photos can be taken in this place a creat an amazing memory.

places.generalDescription: Nestled on the southern shores of Lake Geneva, Parc des Eaux-Vives is a stunning oasis that beautifully marries nature with artistry. With nearly five centuries of history, this park showcases an enchanting landscape filled with vibrant wildflowers, lush greenery, and majestic trees. Ideal for those seeking tranquility and natural beauty, it offers picturesque pathways perfect for leisurely strolls while soaking in breathtaking views of both the lake and the Jura mountains.

sources.snippet: Just on the outskirts of Geneva centre, this is one of the most scenic parks in the city. Constantly changing colour and beautifully kept. Take some time out to fully enjoy the park and get the perfect snap to finish your day.
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Instagrammable Spots In Geneva

places.name: Parc des Eaux-Vives

reviews.text:
Beautiful Park located strategically across Lac Leman or lake geneva.

It covers spacious area with stunning view of the lake, beautiful chateau/mansion and restaurant, plush green trees and beautiful walking trails with beches to seize the day.

I came here at the end of winter, just about to be spring and yet the trees and flowers are growing again already. There are benches, garden and statutes across the property.

There's parking space in front of the park and during weekend or beautiful weather it might be packed fast. There are spots for ‚ôøÔ∏è those using wheelchairs. The walking trails are also accessible and ‚ôøÔ∏è friendly.

There is no charge to get inside the park and enjoy the leisure walk.bring you water and food, please don't litter and keep the park clean and beautiful.

Happy to go back here!

Parc des Eaux-Vives is a serene and picturesque park located in Geneva, Switzerland. Situated on the left bank of Lake Geneva, it offers visitors a blend of natural beauty and historical significance.

The park is renowned for its sloping lawns that descend gracefully towards the lake, providing panoramic views of the water and the city beyond. It's adorned with a variety of mature trees and vibrant flower beds, making it a perfect spot for leisurely walks or picnics. A notable feature is the small pond fed by a stream emerging from a grotto, adding to the park's tranquil ambiance.  Ôøº

Atop the hill within the park stands a historic 18th-century mansion, which now serves as a hotel and restaurant. This manor adds a touch of historical charm to the park and offers visitors an opportunity to dine or stay amidst the lush surroundings.  Ôøº

Parc des Eaux-Vives is one of Geneva's most beautiful and historic parks, located on the south shore of Lake Geneva. The park covers a large area of green lawns, majestic old trees, and walking paths that offer stunning views of the lake and the distant Alps. It's an ideal spot for both locals and tourists looking for relaxation or a peaceful walk away from the city's busy streets.

The park is known for its elegant Eaux-Vives Mansion, which dates back to the 18th century and now functions as a hotel and restaurant. It's a great place to enjoy a meal with panoramic views of the lake.

One hidden gem within the park is its water fountains and sculptures, which add to the charm of the surroundings. There are also sports facilities, including tennis courts and play areas for children. The park's central location and natural splendor make it a perfect destination for an afternoon escape, offering tranquility just minutes from the city center.

places.generalDescription: Promenade de la Treille, located behind Geneva's City Hall, offers stunning views of the Jura and Saleve mountain ranges as well as the city itself. It is home to the world's longest wooden bench, stretching an impressive 120m. The promenade exudes peace and tranquility, making it a must-visit for travelers in Geneva.

sources.snippet: You can find it next to the Old Town of Geneva, in the beautiful Promenade de la Treille. It is set on a hill and actually runs along the Old Town walls, so there are lots of viewing platforms and the views from here are so beautiful, with the mountains and typical Swiss houses in the background!. It is a pretty popular place for people to relax, have picnics and enjoy the beautiful view!
sources.shortName: 17 Geneva Instagram Spots - Best Instagrammable Places in Geneva!

sources.snippet: The Promenade de la Treille is a promenade that runs along the shore of Geneva Lake. The promenade is a popular spot for walking and biking, and it offers stunning views of the lake and the city. The Promenade de la Treille is also a great place to take photographs.
sources.shortName: BEST Instagrammable Places In Geneva In 2022

sources.snippet: The Treille Promenade (‚ÄúPromenade de la Treille‚Äù) is located on the outskirts of the old town, not far from the town hall. In addition to being the oldest in Geneva, it is especially known for its 2 curiosities:
sources.shortName: Visit Geneva: TOP 23 Things To Do and Must See

places.name: Promenade de la Treille

reviews.text:
Promenade de la Treille in Geneva is a hidden gem that offers a tranquil escape in the heart of the city. The iconic Treille vine-covered pergola, believed to be one of the longest in the world, creates a picturesque setting for a leisurely stroll.

Lined with charming benches and framed by vibrant flowers, the promenade provides stunning panoramic views of the city. The historic atmosphere, combined with the natural beauty of the surroundings, makes it an ideal spot for a peaceful retreat.

The sense of history is palpable as you walk through the trellised path, which is particularly enchanting during the blooming season. It's a perfect blend of nature and culture, offering a unique perspective on Geneva's landscape.

Whether you're seeking a quiet moment of reflection or a romantic walk with beautiful scenery, Promenade de la Treille is a must-visit. Its timeless charm and captivating views make it a true oasis within the bustling city.

Promenade de la Treille was built around 1515 as a platform for the defense of the city. In 1774, the famous Treille wooden bench was installed: with its 120 meters of length it's said to be the longest bench in the world. I came here attracted by this fact, but honestly I was a little disappointed because the view from here is nothing special: anyway it's a fine place to take a rest.

This is such a beautiful place to stroll on a calm sunny day! I loved the expansiveness of the walkway. It was a lovely spot to take in the waterfront as well as take pictures.

There are benches spread out to stop and really take in the beauty. If you want to reach this from the main street with the hotels, follow G Maps to get to the underpass that crosses the highway.

places.address: Rpe de la Treille, 1204 Gen√®ve, Switzerland

places.generalDescription: B√¢timent des Forces Motrices (BFM) is a former hydroelectric plant transformed into a modern theater in 1997. Situated on an island in the Rhone River, it offers a unique setting for major dramatic productions, modern dance performances, concert recitals, opera shows, and contemporary art exhibitions. The main building also accommodates numerous smaller theaters, making BFM a vibrant and versatile performance space in Geneva.

sources.snippet: To kick off your Instaworthy Spots of Geneva tour, make your way to the B√¢timent des Forces Motrices, located at Pl. des Volontaires 2, 1204 Gen√®ve, Switzerland, where you‚Äôll meet your knowledgeable and friendly local guide in front of the monumental theatre building. This meeting point isn‚Äôt only convenient but also offers a great starting location for your Instagram-worthy adventure.
sources.shortName: Explore The Instaworthy Spots Of Geneva With A Local

places.name: B√¢timent des Forces Motrices

reviews.text:
Originally constructed as a power plant to harness hydraulic energy from the Rh√¥ne River, it played a crucial role in Geneva's industrial development.
Designed by the Swiss architect Jean-Jacques Rousseau and completed in 1883, the building is an example of industrial architecture with elements of Neo-Renaissance style.
Today, the building is a cultural and events venue, hosting various exhibitions, concerts, and other cultural activities. It has been repurposed to serve as a space for artistic and public events.

The building features a distinctive fa√ßade with ornate detailing, reflecting its industrial past.
The interior is spacious with high ceilings, and the original machinery is still partially visible, providing insight into its historical function.
not a roiyal albert hall but compared to similar smaller places, it has a character
Very good venue to see a show, a play, or a comedian. I watched Laura Laune. Wonderful show. Easy for access by public transport. It is easy to find a place for drink. There are also exhibitions.

places.generalDescription: The Broken Chair is a 12-meter-high wooden sculpture located in front of the Palais des Nations, created by artist Daniel Bursett in 1997. Commissioned by Handicap International, it serves as a powerful protest against cluster bombs and landmines, symbolizing the devastating impact of these weapons on civilians during times of war. The chair's broken leg represents the loss of human limbs caused by landmine explosions.

sources.snippet: The Broken Chair art sculpture is one of Geneva‚Äôs most famous sculptures. It was unveiled in 1997 and was created to commemorate landmine victims, but also strength, vulnerability, fragility and resilience. It has gained worldwide fame and stands at an impressive 12 metres tall with the 4th chair leg being broken halfway up.
sources.shortName: 17 Geneva Instagram Spots - Best Instagrammable Places in Geneva!

sources.snippet: As mentioned in the beginning, Geneva is considered to be the Capital of Peace. One of the reasons is that the UN has headquarters in the city. Even though this is amazing, and you can take many cool pictures of the building and all the flags, a true star of the show is the Broken Chair.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Spots In Geneva

sources.snippet: The Broken Chair is a sculpture in Geneva that was made to symbolise the protest against the use of landmines. The sculpture is really unique and it makes for a great photo op. If you are ever in Geneva, you should definitely check out the Broken Chair.

sources.snippet: An unusual piece of artwork in the city centre that is just made to take photos of. Strike up a silly pose and get a great shot. View this post on Instagram

places.name: Broken Chair

reviews.text: Striking and powerful sculpture symbolising opposition to landmines and violence. Easy to spot right across from the UN entrance, and makes for great photos with the Palais des Nations in the background.

The water display on a hot day is a good cooling tool. Am still to fully grasp the concept of the broken chair though. Luckily on this day there were not so many people and we could take pictures and videos with fewer photo bombers. üòé

The¬†Broken Chair sculpture is in Geneva, it is a powerful symbol advocating for the prohibition of landmines.¬†It is created by Daniel Berset, the 12-meter-high wooden structure features a broken leg, representing the destruction caused by these weapons.¬†It stands as a reminder to world leaders of the human cost of armed violence and the need for international cooperation to protect civilians

places.generalDescription: Place du Bourg-de-Four, Geneva's oldest square, is a bustling area with high-end shops, cafes with patios, and fountains. The Old Town offers ancient passageways and romantic cobblestone squares, with Place du Bourg-de-Four being the busiest example. Visitors can explore ritzy shopping promenades and indulge in chocolate shops like Rhone du Chocolatier.

sources.snippet: The Place du Bourg-de-Four is a square in the centre of Geneva‚Äôs Old Town. The square is surrounded by cafes and shops, and it‚Äôs a popular meeting place for locals. The Place du Bourg-de-Four is also a popular spot for photography, as it offers a great view of the city.
sources.shortName: BEST Instagrammable Places In Geneva In 2022

places.name: Place du Bourg-de-Four

reviews.text: It's a place to visit for the tourists visiting Geneva. You will find here also restaurants and cafes, when starting or after finishing your walks and visits in the old town of Geneva. It is also the starting point or the central point of local activities, like the Escalade in December.

The former city's market place in the Middle Ages, today the square with its 18th-century fountain, medieval houses, art galleries, antique shops and with busy caf√©s and restaurants still remains the hub of Geneva's Old Town- popular meeting spot. Not to be missed, indeed.
Charming historic square with caf√©s, shops, and a lively atmosphere. Perfect for people-watching or enjoying a coffee in the heart of Geneva's old town.
